availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John Connell (Louisville, Kentucky, justice of the peace)

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, justice of the peace. Kentucky native. Married to Sarah Raymond Connell on June 29, 1823. Father of Louisa Connell, Nancy Connell, William L. Connell, James M. Connell, David H. Connell, Smith T. Connell, Martha J. Connell, Angelina Connell, and Laura A. Connell. Carpenter in Louisville in 1850. Justice of the peace in Louisville in 1860.

bibl.p: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville, District 1, p. 48; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville, Ward 2, p. 359; Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville, Ward 4, p. 15; Kentucky, Compiled Marriages, 1802-1850, Ancestry, Bullitt County, Kentucky, June 29, 1823; Kentucky, Death Records, 1852-1964, Ancestry, Louisville, Kentucky, 1872, p. 209.
